climbs.name: Frozen in Time
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Geoff Fullerton and Stan Roy, 1993

content.description: Right most route on Stash Slab. Start by working up to a series of awkwardly angled flakes. Pull, layback, and palm up the flakes with considerable body english and delicate footwork to the easier slab and the anchor. Careful of the roots and pitch at the base.
content.protection: 3 bolts to shared 2 shut anchor with Deep Freeze.
content.location: Right side of the slab, across the stream bed, east of Mushroom Boulder.

climbs.name: Deep Freeze
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Geoff Fullerton & Stan Roy, 1993

content.description: The left most route on Stash Slab. Although short, Deep Freeze is a fun warm up or cool down. Interesting side pulls and sloping edges lead to a balancey pull over the bulge and lower angle slab to the anchor.
content.location: Left side of the Stash Slab, east side of the stream bed, across from Mushroom Boulder.

content.description:
Somehow this obscure route never made it into any guidebook but here it is.

Starting from a loose and unstable slope climb the vertical face above which bulges at the crux. Decent climbing but the

SDS

​​​​ (Sliding Belayer Syndrome) takes away slightly from the appeal.
content.location:
Not actually on

Stash Slab

but about 200 meters around to the left and up the hillside. The base is sloping and unstable dirt so be careful when belaying.
